intro: Sibbaldiopsis cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sibbaldiopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
